resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: Erasure coding: fix 2 failed tests of DFSStripedOutputStream

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description:
TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks#testReadFileWithMissingBlocks is timing out consistently on my local machine.
{noformat}
Running org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 132.405 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks
testReadFileWithMissingBlocks(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks)  Time elapsed: 132.171 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: Timed out waiting for /foo to have all the internalBlocks
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StripedFileTestUtil.waitBlockGroupsReported(StripedFileTestUtil.java:295)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StripedFileTestUtil.waitBlockGroupsReported(StripedFileTestUtil.java:256)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.readFileWithMissingBlocks(TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.java:98)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.testReadFileWithMissingBlocks(TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.java:82)


Results :

Tests in error: 
  TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.testReadFileWithMissingBlocks:82->readFileWithMissingBlocks:98 » Timeout

Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0
{noformat}

comments.body: Failed in this pre-commit: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/21784/testReport/

It is still failing:
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/23401/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs/TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks/testReadFileWithMissingBlocks/
The error is the same, we are timing out:
{code}
Error Message
test timed out after 300000 milliseconds
Stacktrace
java.lang.Exception: test timed out after 300000 milliseconds
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StripedFileTestUtil.verifyPread(StripedFileTestUtil.java:111)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StripedFileTestUtil.verifyPread(StripedFileTestUtil.java:85)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.readFileWithMissingBlocks(TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.java:123)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.testReadFileWithMissingBlocks(TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks.java:82)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod$1.runReflectiveCall(FrameworkMethod.java:47)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:44)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.InvokeMethod.evaluate(InvokeMethod.java:17)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.FailOnTimeout$StatementThread.run(FailOnTimeout.java:74)
{code}
What about increasing the time out?

[~elgoiri]

will try it out and see if increasing time out solves this issue.

[~bharatviswa], I went ahead and tried and no luck here.
I think this was broken since the beginning in HDFS-8978.
[~walter.k.su], [~jingzhao], you guys were involved in that patch; any ideas?

[~elgoiri]

Thanks for info.

Ya even on mac, this test is taking around 2 minutes, and this test has already 5 minutes for time out.

submitting patch with below changes:
* moved cluster setup and teardown out of loop
* file creation only once
* restart stopped DataNodes in every iteration.

Ping  [~walter.k.su], [~jingzhao], [~elgoiri],[~bharatviswa] , mind having a look?

Thanks [~ajayydv]. The indentation of {{testReadFileWithMissingBlocks()}} it's a little weird in  [^HDFS-12723.000.patch].
Do you mind giving an overview on why it was failing before?
I'm specially curious why the buffer went from 1k to 2k.

Thanks [~ajayydv] for the description; basically we are reducing the number of setups which makes sense.
The unit tests run successfully [here|https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/23471/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs/TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks/].
The test is still kind of long (3 minutes and 23 seconds); I compared to another execution [yesterday|https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/23463/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs/TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks/] and this one took 3 minutes and 51 seconds.
Is there something we can do to improve it further?

[~elgoiri] Only other two options i can think of is either reduce the file size. (Reducing the file by 1/3 makes this test run under 1 minute in my machine) or use EC policy with less parity blocks to reduce no of iterations.

If we reduce the size of the file, will we still have enough blocks to test?
I would be concern on the coverage in that case.
[~elgoiri] ya, i am also not sure if 2 or 4 data blocks are enough for test coverage instead of currently configured 6.

I tested  [^HDFS-12723.001.patch] and I still see the timeout.
{code}
[ERROR] testReadFileWithMissingBlocks(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestReadStripedFileWithMissingBlocks)  Time elapsed: 48.058 s  <<< ERROR!
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: Timed out waiting for /foo to have all the internalBlocks
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StripedFileTestUtil.waitBlockGroupsReported(StripedFileTestUtil.java:296)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StripedFileTestUtil.waitBlockGroupsReported(StripedFileTestUtil.java:257)
{code}

[~elgoiri], this timeout is different than test timeout, this indicates no of total live datanodes are less than required  no 9. I was thinking of increasing numDNs to little more than 9 as even 1 dead/slow DN will result in test failure. Could you please try again by {{private final int numDNs = dataBlocks + parityBlocks;}} set to {{private final int numDNs = dataBlocks + parityBlocks+2;}}

If you agree with increasing {{numDNs}} i can update the patch.

Thanks [~ajayydv], with two extra DNs, the unit test passes.
Let's get this committed with the +2 DNs to fix this test.
We should open a new JIRA to make this test leaner; right now, in my machine it takes around 1.5GB and 2 full cores for 160 seconds.
[~elgoiri] thanks for testing this, updated patch v2 has increased DNs.

+1 on  [^HDFS-12723.002.patch].
Let's wait for Yetus to double check though.
[~ajayydv], do you mind opening the JIRA to discuss how to make this test lighter?
Which versions does this apply? Only 3.X, AFAIK, striped is not available in 2.X, right?
[~elgoiri], Created [HDFS-13285] to address that. I think it applies to only 3.X. Thanks for review.

The Yetus run for [^HDFS-12723.002.patch] was clean and after testing locally the unit test passes consistently.
Even though this test is pretty heavy and slow, this will be an improvement and will remove one spurious failed unit test.
+1

If nobody is against, I'll commit this tomorrow.
Meanwhile, we can work on making it leaner in HDFS-13285.

Thanks [~ajayydv] for the fix.
I committed to trunk, branch-3.1 and branch-3.0.
